alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 14 at 5:09PM EST until November 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Efficient rainfall rates, with between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen associated with this storm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area over the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Miami Gardens, Cooper City, West Park, Royal Palm Ranches, Miramar Parkway And University Drive, Pembroke Park and Ives Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
